Posted By: StagemasterK (1/6/2012 12:04:21 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: @StagemasterK: Urza's Destiny was released June 23, 1999; Time Streams was published some time before that (Salvation wiki says May 1999, but claims its first printing was April 1, 1999; Amazon.com says March 1, 1999). Obviously if they both featured the same quote, the author of the book was involved in writing the flavor text, so maybe he had Rayne say it in an earlier draft but changed it to Barrin for the final version.
posts.html:
@StagemasterK: Urza's Destiny was released June 23, 1999; Time Streams was published some time before that (Salvation wiki says May 1999, but claims its first printing was April 1, 1999; Amazon.com says March 1, 1999). Posted By: tavaritz (10/7/2011 4:51:08 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I like that the card has such an high rating, since I hope for a 1/1 reprint with changeling (when not in play and choose a creature type when in play). But a card like this is only useful when you play more than 1 card of the chosen type per turn. In any other cases, a simple mana artifact is more useful/versatile (see [Worn Powerstone](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Worn Powerstone) or [Thran Dynamo](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thran Dynamo)).
posts.html:
